1.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
there is or are (or any other form of the verb to be, as may suit the connection)
silver (from its pale color); by implication, money

a going forth, i.e. (the act) an egress, or (the place) an exit; hence, a source or product; specifically, dawn, the rising of the sun (the East), exportation, utterance, a gate, a fountain, a mine, a meadow (as producing grass)
properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)
gold, figuratively, something gold-colored (i.e. yellow), as oil, a clear sky

2.brief: iron (as cutting); by extension, an iron implement
dust (as powdered or gray); hence, clay, earth, mud
to take (in the widest variety of applications)
to pour out, i.e. (figuratively) smelt, utter

3.brief: an extremity; adverbially (with prepositional prefix) after
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
the dark; hence (literally) darkness; figuratively, misery, destruction, death, ignorance, sorrow, wickedness
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
properly, to penetrate; hence, to examine intimately
shade of death, i.e. the grave (figuratively, calamity)

4.brief: to break out (in many applications, direct and indirect, literal and figurative)
a stream, especially a winter torrent; (by implication) a (narrow) valley (in which a brook runs); also a shaft (of a mine)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
properly, to turn aside from the road (for a lodging or any other purpose), i.e. sojourn (as a guest); also to shrink, fear (as in a strange place); also to gather forhostility (as afraid)
to mislay, i.e. to be oblivious of, from want of memory or attention
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda
to slacken or be feeble; figuratively, to be oppressed
a man in general (singly or collectively)
to waver, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively (as subjoined)

5.brief: the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
food (for man or beast), especially bread, or grain (for making it)
the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.
to turn about or over; by implication, to change, overturn, return, pervert
a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so

6.brief: properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)
a gem (perhaps used for scratching other substances), probably the sapphire
dust (as powdered or gray); hence, clay, earth, mud
gold, figuratively, something gold-colored (i.e. yellow), as oil, a clear sky

7.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
a hawk or other bird of prey
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to tan (by sunburning); figuratively (as if by a piercing ray) to scan
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)

8.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to tread; by implication, to walk; also to string abow (by treading on it in bending)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to advance, i.e. pass on or continue; causatively, to remove; specifically, to bedeck (i.e. bring an ornament upon)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

9.brief: to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
to turn about or over; by implication, to change, overturn, return, pervert
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)

10.brief: properly, a cliff (or sharp rock, as compressed); generally, a rock or boulder; figuratively, a refuge; also an edge (as precipitous)
a channel, e.g. a fosse, canal, shaft; specifically the Nile, as the one river of Egypt, including its collateral trenches; also the Tigris, as the main river of Assyria
to cleave; generally, to rend, break, rip or open
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
value, i.e. (concretely) wealth; abstractly, costliness, dignity
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)

11.brief: a weeping; by analogy, a dripping
a stream (including the sea; expectation the Nile, Euphrates, etc.); figuratively, prosperity
to wrap firmly (especially a turban, compress, or saddle); figuratively, to stop, to rule
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)

12.brief: where? (only in connection with prepositional prefix, whence)
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present
the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)

13.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
a man in general (singly or collectively)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively

14.brief: an abyss (as a surging mass of water), especially the deep (the main sea or the subterranean watersupply)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle

15.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
properly, shut up, i.e. the breast (as enclosing the heart); also gold (as generally shut up safely)
the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to suspend or poise (especially in trade)
silver (from its pale color); by implication, money

to hang up, i.e. weigh, or (figuratively) contemn
properly, something carved out, i.e. ore; hence, gold (pure as originally mined)
Ophir, the name of a son of Joktan, and of a gold region in the East
a gem, probably the beryl (from its pale green color)
a gem (perhaps used for scratching other substances), probably the sapphire

17.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to set in a row, i.e. arrange, put in order (in a very wide variety of applications)
gold, figuratively, something gold-colored (i.e. yellow), as oil, a clear sky
something prepared, i.e. any apparatus (as an implement, utensil, dress, vessel or weapon)

18.brief: something high in value, i.e. perhaps coral
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male

19.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to set in a row, i.e. arrange, put in order (in a very wide variety of applications)
Cush (or Ethiopia), the name of a son of Ham, and of his territory; also of an Israelite
properly, something carved out, i.e. ore; hence, gold (pure as originally mined)
pure (in a physical, chemical, ceremonial or moral sense)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to hang up, i.e. weigh, or (figuratively) contemn

20.brief: where? (only in connection with prepositional prefix, whence)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)

21.brief: to veil from sight, i.e. conceal (literally or figuratively)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
a bird (as covered with feathers, or rather as covering with wings), often collectively
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
to hide (by covering), literally or figuratively

22.brief: death (natural or violent); concretely, the dead, their place or state (hades); figuratively, pestilence, ruin
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
something heard, i.e. a sound, rumor, announcement; abstractly, audience

23.brief: gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)

24.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
to scan, i.e. look intently at; by implication, to regard with pleasure, favor or care
the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

25.brief: to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
to balance, i.e. measure out (by weight or dimension); figuratively, arrange, equalize, through the idea of levelling (ment. estimate, test)
properly, extension, i.e. height or breadth; also a measure (including its standard); hence a portion (as measured) or a vestment; specifically, tribute (as measured)

26.brief: to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
an enactment; hence, an appointment (of time, space, quantity, labor or usage)
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb

27.brief: at that time or place; also as a conjunction, therefore
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
properly, to score with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe, and also to enumerate; intensively, to recount, i.e. celebrate

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
properly, to penetrate; hence, to examine intimately

28.brief: ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
fear (also used as infinitive); morally, reverence
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
